Open to only grade 11. https://arts.princeton.edu/about/opportunities/high-school-contests/ten-minute-play-contest/

National High School Musical Theater Awards: National celebration of outstanding student achievement, recognizing individual artistry in vocal, dance, and acting performance and elevating the importance of theatre arts education in schools. Students must be nominated as a high school team by winning their Regional Awards Program competition. Open to grades 9-12 https://www.jimmyawards.com/

New Voices One-Act Competition for Young Playwrights: Theater competition that encourages young writers to submit their original one-act plays, with a focus on fostering creativity and developing the next generation of playwrights. Open to ages 19 and under. https://youthplays.com/submit_play.php

Ten-Minute Play Contest: Challenges playwrights to craft concise and compelling stories within a strict 10-minute time frame, pushing the boundaries of dramatic storytelling and creativity. To enter, playwrights must submit an original play that can be performed in 10 minutes or less, with a focus on innovative storytelling, strong characters, and effective pacing. Open to only grade 11. https://arts.princeton.edu/about/opportunities/high-school-contests/ten-minute-play-contest/

Writopia Lab's Worldwide Plays Festival: Global playwriting competition that invites young writers to submit their original plays, with the goal of discovering and showcasing new talent from around the world. The competition requires submissions of full-length or short plays, and selected winners will have their plays produced and performed at the festival, providing a unique opportunity for young playwrights to see their work brought to life on stage. Open to all ages. https://www.writopialab.org/programs/specialty-programs/worldwide-plays-festival/the-competition

YoungArts: Encourages young artists to submit work in various categories, including visual arts, writing, film, music and theater. Selected winners receive scholarships, mentorship, and performance opportunities along with the chance to participate in exclusive workshops. Open to grades 10-12 (ages 15-18). https://youngarts.org/
Volunteering & Community Service: Carson Scholars Fund: Awards $1,000 college scholarships to students who excel academically and are dedicated to serving their communities. Focuses on encouraging and rewarding students for their involvement in volunteer work that benefits the community. Schools must request to be added to the distribution list in order for students to apply. Open to grades 4-11. https://carsonscholars.org/scholarships/scholarship-application-request/

Gloria Barron Prize for Young Heroes (Difficulty ★★★★★): Honors 25 outstanding young leaders each year who have made significant positive impacts on people and the environment across the U.S. and Canada. Each winner receives a $10,000 award to support their higher education or service project. Open to ages 8-18 https://barronprize.org/

NJCL Community Service Competition: National competition that recognizes and rewards students who have demonstrated exceptional commitment to community service and volunteer work, with a focus on promoting civic engagement, social responsibility, and character development among young people. Open to grades 9-12. https://www.njcl.org/Students/Non-Convention-Contests/NJCL-Community-Service

The President's Volunteering Service Award (PVSA): Rewards students who have demonstrated a commitment to volunteering over the time frame of a year. Open to all ages. https://presidentialserviceawards.gov/
Writing: Anhinga Prize for Poetry: National poetry competition that recognizes and rewards outstanding poetry collections by emerging and established poets, with a focus on promoting innovative and exceptional poetry. Open to all ages. https://www.anhingapress.org/anhinga-robert-dana-prize

Carl Sandburg Student Poetry Contest: Encourages young students to write poetry based on a theme which changes each year. Each theme is one word that is left up to the poets to craft a outstanding piece of winning poetry. Open to grades 3-12. https://www.nps.gov/carl/learn/news/student-poetry-contest.html

Creative Communication Writing Contests: Series of national writing competitions that recognize and reward outstanding writing by students, with a focus on promoting creative writing, self-expression, and literacy among young people. The contests invite students to submit their original writing in a variety of categories, including poetry, short stories, and essays, and provide an opportunity for students to showcase their writing talents. Open to grades K-9. https://www.poeticpower.com/

Haiku Society of America: National poetry competitions that recognize and reward outstanding haiku poetry written by students, with a focus on promoting the traditional forms of Japanese poetry and encouraging young people to explore the art of haiku writing. Each competition has different age ranges for participation. https://www.hsa-haiku.org/hsa-contests.htm#virgilio

Horizon Academic Essay Prize: Recognizes and rewards outstanding essays written by students on a specific topic or theme, with a focus on encouraging critical thinking, research, and writing skills. To participate, students must submit an original essay that demonstrates a deep understanding of the topic, as well as strong analytical and argumentative skills. Open to grades 9-12. https://horizoninspires.com/essay-prize/

I Matter Poetry Contest: Poetry competition that invites students to write poetry different themes that promote self-expression, creativity, and empowerment among young people. For example, one of the themes was related to the importance of the Black Lives Matter Movement. Open to grades K-12. https://www.nationalyouthfoundation.org/i-matter/

Jane Austen Society Essay Contest: Invites students to analyze and write about themes, characters, and historical contexts in Jane Austen’s works, fostering a deeper appreciation for her literature. Open to grades 9-12. https://jasna.org/programs/essay-contest/

John Locke Institute Essay Competition: Encourages students to develop the characteristics that create into great writers: independent thought, depth of knowledge, clear reasoning, critical analysis and persuasive style while exploring a wide range of interesting questions. Open to ages 15-18. https://www.johnlockeinstitute.com/essay-competition

Kenyon Review Poetry Contest: Literary competition that awards prizes for outstanding poetry, with the goal of recognizing and promoting exceptional poetic talent, and providing a platform for poets to share their work and gain recognition in the literary world. Open to grades 9 and 12 (Grades 10 and 11: See Patricia Grodd Poetry Prize for Young Writers). https://kenyonreview.org/submit/poetry-contest/

Kenyon Review Short Fiction Contest: Literary competition that awards prizes for outstanding short fiction pieces, such as short stories, with the goal of recognizing exceptional writing and providing a platform for writers to share their work and gain recognition in the literary world. Open to grades 9-12. https://kenyonreview.org/submit/short-fiction/

Kenyon Review Short Nonfiction Contest: Literary competition that awards prizes for outstanding short nonfiction pieces, such as essays and memoir excerpts, with the goal of recognizing and promoting exceptional nonfiction writing, and providing a platform for writers to share their work and gain recognition in the literary world. Open to grades 9-12. https://kenyonreview.org/submit/short-nonfiction-contest/

Manningham Student Poetry Awards: Poetry competition that recognizes and rewards outstanding poetry written by students. Aims to showcase their poetic talents and receive feedback and recognition from established poets and literary critics, with the goal of encouraging and nurturing a love of poetry and creative writing among students. Open to grades 6-12. https://www.nfsps.com/manningham.html

Max Ritvo Poetry Prize: National poetry competition that recognizes and rewards outstanding poetry collections by emerging poets to provide a platform for poets to share their work with a wider audience, while also honoring the legacy of Max Ritvo, a talented young poet who passed away in 2016. Open to all ages. https://milkweed.org/max-ritvo-poetry-prize

National Scholastic Art & Writing Awards: Recognizes creative excellence in writing, offering students opportunities for scholarships and national recognition. Open to grades 7-12. https://www.artandwriting.org/awards/how-to-enter/

New York Times Student Review Contest: Invites students worldwide to craft original reviews of creative works that debuted in a specific year. Participants can choose from a wide array of categories, including books, movies, music, art, fashion, technology, and more. Each review must be 450 words or fewer and reflect the student's personal experience and perspective. Open to ages 13-19. https://www.nytimes.com/2023/10/24/learning/our-9th-annual-student-review-contest.html

Patricia Grodd Poetry Prize for Young Writers: Literary competition that awards prizes for outstanding poetry, with the goal of recognizing and promoting exceptional poetic talent, and providing a platform for poets to share their work and gain recognition in the literary world. Open to grades 10 and 11 (Grades 9 and 12: See Kenyon Review Poetry Contest). https://kenyonreview.org/submit/patricia-grodd/

Poetry Society of America: National organization that promotes and celebrates poetry in all its forms, with a focus on supporting poets, fostering a love of poetry, and providing opportunities for poets to share their work with a wider audience. Offers many different programs and awards. Each award may be open to different age ranges. https://poetrysociety.org/awards/annual-awards/2022-student-poetry

Princeton Leonard L. Milberg ’53 High School Poetry Prize: Recognizes outstanding work by student writers, encouraging students to showcase their talent and creativity through the power of poetry. Open to only grade 11. https://arts.princeton.edu/about/opportunities/high-school-contests/poetry-contest/

REALM Award: Recognizes excellent literary magazines produced by students and encourages all students to develop literary magazines that celebrate the art and craft of writing. Open to grades 6-12. https://ncte.org/awards/realm-awards/apply/

River of Words Contest: National poetry and art contest that invites students to explore and express their connection to the natural world, with a focus on promoting environmental awareness, creativity, and self-expression. The contest encourages students to submit their original poetry and artwork that reflects their observations, feelings, and thoughts about the natural world. Open to grades K-12. https://www.stmarys-ca.edu/centers-institutes/center-environmental-literacy/river-of-words

Sejong Cultural Society Poetry Competition: National poetry competition that recognizes and rewards outstanding poetry written by students, with a focus on promoting Korean culture and language, as well as creative writing and literary excellence among young people. Open to all ages. https://www.sejongculturalsociety.org/writing/current/index.php

SPJ/JEA High School Essay Contest: Prompts students to explore the importance of journalism and the First Amendment's freedom of press by writing essays on a given prompt. Open to grades 9-12. https://jea.org/awards/spj-jea-high-school-essay-contest/

Storytellers of Tomorrow Writing Contest: Invites students to submit their original stories of up to 2000 words. Stories are graded on their overall quality and ability to engage the reader with their rhetoric. Open to grades 9-12. https://www.ringling.edu/academics/majors/creative-writing/storytellers-of-tomorrow/

The Adroit Prizes for Poetry & Prose (Difficulty ★★★★★): Annual awards that recognize the best emerging writers in the genres of poetry and prose, with the goal of promoting literary excellence, encouraging new voices, and providing a platform for young writers to share their work and gain recognition in the literary community. Open to grades 9-12. https://theadroitjournal.org/adroit-prizes/

The Bennington Young Writers Awards: Invites students to submit original poetry, fiction, and nonfiction works, providing an opportunity for young writers to showcase their creativity and literary talent. Open to grades 9-12. https://www.bennington.edu/events/young-writers-awards

Writing in Horticulture Contest: Invites students to showcase their understanding and appreciation of horticulture through original writing. Submissions can include essays, poems, or stories that creatively explore topics like plant science, gardening, sustainability, or the impact of horticulture on communities. Open to ages 5-22. https://www.njha.org/officer-requirements-obligations-708823-236853-785410-701059-708757.html

Writing, Visual, Multimedia Contest: creative competition that challenges students to express their thoughts, ideas, and imagination through a variety of mediums, including writing, visual arts, and media productions. The contest invites students to submit their original work and to showcase their skills in storytelling, critical thinking, and creative expression. Open to grades 6-12. https://quillandscroll.org/2024-writing-photo-multimedia-contest-results/

YoungArts: Encourages young artists to submit work in various categories, including visual arts, writing, film, music and theater. Selected winners receive scholarships, mentorship, and performance opportunities along with the chance to participate in exclusive workshops. Open to grades 10-12 (ages 15-18). https://youngarts.org/
